author: kdawson
title: Malicious Spam Jumps To 3B Messages Per Day

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: Trailrunner7 writes Last year saw a monstrous increase in the volume of malicious spam according to a new report PDF.

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: In the second half of 2009 the number of spam messages sent per day skyrocketed from 600 million to three billion according to new research.

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: For some time now spam has been accounting for 90 or more percent of all email messages.

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: But the volume of spam had been relatively steady in the last couple of years.

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: Now the emergence of several largescale botnets including Zeus and Koobface has led to an enormous spike in the volume of spam.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: What about delicious spam?

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: ?What about it?

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: Its slightly less fictional than unicorn bacon?

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: ?I think thats an oxymoron.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: Clearly you havent had it mixed with vienna sausages and  anchovies.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: yum

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: How about something with a little less spam In it?

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: Theres:

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: http:www.youtube.comwatch?vanwy2MPT5RE youtube.com

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: Why cant ISPs detect large numbers of messages suddenly going to a vast array of email address and shut it down?Nobody normally does that seems like it should be easy behavior to detect and stamp out algorithmically.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Because one person sending a mailshot to a hundred or so people looks a lot like a botnet.One person mailing their CV to 200 companies can look a lot like a botnet.One teenage girl telling everyone about a party can look a lot like a spammer.Sure if the botnet isnt well written then itll just blast spam out of every node 247 but the really good ones are going to try hard to evade detection.Hell if youve got enough compromised PCs and youre organised as modern botnet herders are then you can collect a lot of good data on how regular users send email and make sure the nodes of your botnet avoid going far outside the curve.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: And what would be so bad about ISPs blocking that??

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: Yeah well if it quacks like a duck...Seriously if you are trying to communicate with hundreds of people there are technologies meant for that.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: Email isnt one of them.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: Id be happy if more of the bigger mail services recognized my mail server for my hobby sites user signups as nonspam.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: Despite the fact the MX on record is the sending server and the domain for the MX has been up for a while.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: Ive in the past year retired the use of my companys domain name and revised my hobby site to use a newer domain.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: Just the same this has been over the course of a year not all at once.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: That or the herders adjust their botnet so the behavior of each node is such that it *becomes* the curve...

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Although I think very low of the morality of those who do this for a living but at times you really have to respect their skills.This isnt just like running an email service for a fortune 500 company its more like running a black ops email service for a fortune 500 company.Every aspect of the operation is ran over with a fine tooth comb for discretion.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Not too many from each node sending out the spam messages at a low rate redundancy resource management payroll.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: This cannot be easy.Too bad these people are going with a life of crime with their potential I would think they could do very well in legitimate work.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Although I think very low of the morality of those who do this for a living but at times you really have to respect their skills.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Skills?

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: I think its more a case of even a blind pig occasionally turns up a nut.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: There are so many wannabe spammers and wannabe hackers and wannabe whatevershotthisweek that it doesnt take much of a success rate to land a ton of spam in your inbox and mine.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: I susspect that at least 85 of the people who read Slashdot could do a better job of spamming than the spammers if they were so inclined.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: The messages arent identicalThe messages dont originate from just one machine but from botnet zombies scattered all over the net with distributed command and control with multiple contingencies for regaining controlThe messages dont end up at just one mail hostBy the time its detected the damage is already doneAnyone who does detect it isnt in a position to stop it from happening againBasically what youre suggesting boils down to throttling the entire Internet so that it cant handle the capacity of spamming which will make it useless for any email delivery.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: You might as well just kill email.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: Original poster here maybe I should elaborate.Why dont ISPs providing service to home users require outgoing SMTP to pass through the ISP mailserver firewalling port 25 and flagblock extreme usage so that their customers virus infected machines dont spew further garbage into the Internet?In the very rare case where a customer needs to run a mailing list or the like allow them to change their thresholds in their user profile.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: For those who dont intend to send hundreds of thousands of messages it might actually be of some benefit to them to shut down the spigot and send them a warning that their computers infected.I dont want to throttle the whole Internet just implement some form of rationality test on mail output at the ISP level.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: ?I refer you again to number 2.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: I think you underestimate how many machines are in a given botnet and therefore overestimate how much spam one machine in that botnet sends.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: They could easily slide under an ISPs peruser email volume limit and still participate in a millionstrong spam.

sent.goldlabel: spam filters in Gmail and other clients yahoomail hotmail
sent.sent: Gmail works flawlessly.

sent.goldlabel: spam filters in Gmail and other clients yahoomail hotmail
sent.sent: I havent seen spam in years and because its never accidentally flagged a real message Ive made a filter that automatically deletes any spam instead of filling up a spam folder that Ill never check.If ISPs and other email providers cant provide the same level of service then they suck.

botnets and spammers

sent.goldlabel: spam filters in Gmail and other clients yahoomail hotmail

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: If we incorporate a pay per email scheme with an email costing anywhere from 12 to 1 cent per email....with a cap being set by the government so you dont get screwed over by the ISP not only would it be beneficial for the ISP as less bandwidth because less spam but also people infected would be aware that they are infected if not by the first bill then by the second billing.I am aware of my downloads next bill cause i see the extra bandwith used but i dont see the emails sent.If i get charged on the side and see 1 million emails but a cap of 20 lets say then you bet your *ss I will clean my pc andget myself organized not to get billed for that again.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: People that spend no time monitoring their system have no clue unless someone points it out for them.By forcing a pay per email you also make sure to have paper trails and someone has to pay for that..eventually as the botnets die out the spammers will have to charge more for the less they are making or it will not be worthwhile for them and the spam kings will slowly go out of business.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Right now they incorporate the pricing into what they charge their clients but if you raise the cost because now legit spammers have to pay per email you will get clients investing elsewhere for their marketing.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: I get more paper spam in my mailbox than email spam that slips past spamassassin.So... if capital one sent me two credit card offers per week for several years and each cost at least 50 cents to print and post that one CC company is spending 50yr trying to win my business... but charging 1 cent per email will stop spam?I get coupon magazines that I toss out.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: For over a decade when I get a phone book I toss it out.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: I get endless catalogs.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: All of which cost several orders of magnitude more than one cent.Also if theres one thing the cellphone and landline business has shown its impossible to bill in units below about one cent per minute or below about 20 per total bill.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: They will have to charge WAY more than one cent just to recover the costs of the billing infrastructure.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Your post advocates a  technical X legislative X marketbased   vigilanteapproach to fighting spam.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Your idea will not work.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Here is why it wont work.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: One or more of the following may apply to your particular idea and it may have other flaws which used to vary from state to state before a bad federal law was passed.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Spammers can easily use it to harvest email addressesX Mailing lists and other legitimate email uses would be affected  No one will be able to find the guy or collect the money  It is defenseless against brute force attacks  It will stop spam for two weeks and then well be stuck with itX Users of email will not put up with itX Microsoft will not put up with it  The police will not put up with it  Requires too much cooperation from spammersX Requires immediate total cooperation from everybody at once  Many email users cannot afford to lose business or alienate potential employers  Spammers dont care about invalid addresses in their lists  Anyone could anonymously destroy anyone elses career or businessSpecifically your plan fails to account for  Laws expressly prohibiting itX Lack of centrally controlling authority for emailX Open relays in foreign countries  Ease of searching tiny alphanumeric address space of all email addressesX AsshatsX Jurisdictional problemsX Unpopularity of weird new taxes  Public reluctance to accept weird new forms of moneyX Huge existing software investment in SMTP  Susceptibility of protocols other than SMTP to attack  Willingness of users to install OS patches received by email  Armies of worm riddled broadbandconnected Windows boxes  Eternal arms race involved in all filtering approachesX Extreme profitability of spam  Joe jobs andor identity theftX Technically illiterate politicians  Extreme stupidity on the part of people who do business with spammers  Dishonesty on the part of spammers themselves  Bandwidth costs that are unaffected by client filteringX Outlookand the following philosophical objections may also apply:X Ideas similar to yours are easy to come up with yet none have ever been shown practical  Any scheme based on optout is unacceptableX SMTP headers should not be the subject of legislation  Blacklists suck  Whitelists suck  We should be able to talk about Viagra without being censored  Countermeasures should not involve wire fraud or credit card fraud  Countermeasures should not involve sabotage of public networksX Countermeasures must work if phased in graduallyX Sending email should be free  Why should we have to trust you and your servers?

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Incompatiblity with open source or open source licenses  Feelgood measures do nothing to solve the problem  Temporaryonetime email addresses are cumbersome  I dont want the government reading my emailX Killing them that way is not slow and painful enoughFurthermore this is what I think about you:X Sorry dude but I dont think it would work.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: This is a stupid idea and youre a stupid person for suggesting it.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: Nice try assh0le

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: Im going to find out where you live and burn your house down

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Ive NEVER seen all four of those checked before on a singular suggestion.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: SO I will attempt to propose the PERFECT solution which will obviously have to take into account all four options .... THIS would definitely solve the problem.We need to pass a law that would create an incentive for Private Companies to generate an electric shock device that would automatically send a large electrical shock to anyone OPENING SPAM legislation to define SPAM as broadly as possible and contain SNOPES and Chain letter provisions.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: The Winning companys device would be awarded the ONE days cost of SPAM to be determined.This is based on my basic premise .... STUPID should hurt.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Your post advocates ax lack of technical knowdlegde X ignorance  dumbass comment   poor choice of wordsHeres why your thoughts on why my idea will not work do not hold waterX Mailing lists and other legitimate email uses would be affectedOf course they would and that is the reason why they incorporate it into the billing being legit they would do that non legit not so much.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Users of email will not put up with itYou put up with being charged per phone call on your cell with a cap per month dont you?

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Microsoft will not put up with itM has nothing to say about the amount of emails coming or going as long as they make money on the licenses using the software to do such actions and might even create a new one to help monitor this new functionality and make even more profits.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Requires immediate total cooperation from everybody at onceSpecifically your plan fails to account forX Lack of centrally controlling authority for emailBecause we do not have a governing body for the internet as a whole???

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: Wow...rollseyesX Open relays in foreign countriesSo what you are saying is that international communication does not exist by internetX AsshatsExplain this one to me I am sure I my visual does not do you justiceX Jurisdictional problemsEach country have their own cell phone companies why would this be any different?

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Unpopularity of weird new taxesWow i mentioned a payment structure for a service and you already want to tax it even though it would be the companies making money on this that would pay their revenue taxes you should become a politician.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Huge existing software investment in SMTPAdding a few lines of code or a new service into an already existing infrasrtucture is not the end of the world...look at when spam first came out or when dns cache poisoning came out it is doable if we want to get it done.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Extreme profitability of spamExactly my point now non legit spammers will have to raise their prices and force their clients to rethink if they want to spend 10 times the amount of money to keep spamming for that 1 that are gullible enough to think the nigerian king is really trying to send them his money.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Technically illiterate politiciansHave i mentioned you should run for politics...X OutlookThe software or your bleak vision of what our future HAS to be...and the following philosophical objections may also apply:X Ideas similar to yours are easy to come up with yet none have ever been shown practicalNone have been implemented at the level that lets say DNS cahce poisoning has and needs to be.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X SMTP headers should not be the subject of legislationWow tell that to the white house with their million or so emails that went missing and forced Obama to rethink his cyber policies for future presidents to come.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Countermeasures must work if phased in graduallyThis can not be phased in slowly it has to be done one shot like digital tv was for it to work.

sent.goldlabel: charging for email to fight spam
sent.sent: X Sending email should be freeYour sentiment not mine.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: X Killing them that way is not slow and painful enoughKilling who exactly slashdot readers?

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: Your doing a good job so far...Furthermore this is what I think about you:X Sorry dude but I dont think it would work.Sorry dude your self absorbed ranting about what you think without at least giving any real sound proof of your background in this field or any real points to substantiate your claims make me think you are just trying to push an opinion and like mine no one really cares the difference between yours and mine is I understand my opinion does not matter but the idea I am trying to convey is to try and help by offering a potential idea to help others you only have managed to waste my time and yours by trying to grab some 15 minutes of fame by shooting down someonesidea.

sent.goldlabel: START
botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Spammers already make a metric fuckton of money2.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Crooks willing to hijack computers wont be deterred from stealing financial information to pay email fees with.3.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: Such crooks are already using zombie computers so the victims would get stuck paying anyway

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: Am I the only one who read this headline and thought 59 messages a day isnt so bad?

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: It looked like 38 to me

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: I went 3 x 1012 spam mails?

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: That is a LOT

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: I read it as 3 bytes.

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: The report is very well written and provides very interesting information but whoever decided to use light grey on white should get his or her eyes poked out with a needle.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: Yeah we can see how much of a wonderful difference all those filtering programs that are on the market today are doing for the worldwide spamming problem.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: That is no difference.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: If you want to do something about the spamming problem start looking beyond your own nose.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: Stop adjusting your filtering rules constantly.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: Pay attention to the cause of the problem  spam is an economic problem.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: Until something is done about the profitmotive and the insane margins of profit behind spam the problem will only continue to grow.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: That is no difference.Spam filters are not there to stop spam  theyre there to stop YOU from receiving it.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: Most people are completely unaware of how much spam gets blocked between when the spammer sends it and when it would have ended up in their inbox.Now if we removed ALL spam filters we might actually find that as productivity ground to a halt people might actually do something about the problem and kill off the botnets and spam organisations that cause all these issues... or people might just complain but go on as usual and the volume might actually go DOWN as the ROI for each blast of spam would increase.

sent.goldlabel: adverse effects of spam clossing bandwidth raising latency
sent.sent: Its not an economic problem because there is little profit in spam from a legitimate business.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: If there were they wouldnt require the use of botnets to steal other peoples resources.

sent.goldlabel: botnets and spammers
sent.sent: The spammer can only profit because their overhead is being spread to unsuspecting users on a global scale.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: At some

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: probably low cost you can induce people to

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: find the spammers.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: spam and give them email accounts at a site that the

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: spammers can freely target.

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: These people are the real

sent.goldlabel: ISP obligations to fight spam
sent.sent: cause of spam.

children.author: fregare
children.title: spam is wasted bandwidth: I call BullShit

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: What exactly do we learn from 24?

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC

sent.goldlabel: END
sent.sent: OIE VEY.

children.author: TheNarrator
children.title: Hosting mail forwarding is ridiculous too

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: I have a domain name that I do mail forwarding for.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: Some botnet owner decided it was worth finding emails to spam to on this domain.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: So now every single day 247 365 days a year once or twice a minute I get an attempt to send an email to fsdfs34mydomain.com where fsdfs34 gets replaced with every possible email conceivable.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: At first I decided to add an ip blocker for anyone who spammed me but it soon slowed down my mail server so much that I had to take it out once the list grew into the 10s of thousands of ips.Now I just greylist and tightly check EHELOs which seems to keep any of the spam from getting anywhere.

sent.goldlabel: domain management and spam
sent.sent: Nevertheless the attempts come relentlessly and continuously like clockwork form ips all over the world.

children.author: Anonymous22
children.title: Malicious spam report  in PDF format ROFL

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: In other news Lifehackers Remains of the Day for today reports that 80 of malicious exploits use Adobe Acrobat PDF files as an attack vector.

sent.goldlabel: report announcing 3B spam messages sent per day and reactions
sent.sent: Download the report and get infected

sent.goldlabel: END
sent.sent: ROFL

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: As much as I hate spam I hate overzealous gateways on the internet more.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: Earthlink for example refuses to receive mail without a valid return address so noreply must respond to RESP and sends you one of these:I apologize for this automatic reply to your email.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: To control spam I now allow incoming messages only from senders I have approved beforehand.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: If you would like to be added to my list of approved senders please fill out the short request form see link below.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: Once I approve you I will receive your original message in my inbox.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: You do not need to resend your message.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: I apologize for this onetime inconvenience.

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: Click the link below to fill out the request:

sent.goldlabel: spam fighting strategies Post Fix Spam Assassin Appriver block lists ISPbased filters Bayesian filters separate email accounts
sent.sent: Theres no way Ill waste my time filling in that form so Ive added big warning on the registration page now  sorry users of a overzealous ISP please disable your spam filter if you can or just use another email address to register from.
